Xi opts for strong-arm approach ahead of meeting with Trump
subhead: The Chinese president believes he has learned from past failures with his American counterpart, whom he is set to meet again on Thursday in South Korea. He has notably used rare earth elements, crucial to new technologies, as a powerful bargaining chip.

Centrists appear to defeat far right in Dutch election, exit poll shows
Western Sahara: US goes on offensive at UN to defend autonomy under Moroccan sovereignty
subhead: On Thursday, the UN Security Council is set to vote on a draft resolution aimed at clarifying the territory's status, which is contested by Rabat and the pro-independence Polisario Front. The US-backed motion aims to boost the prospect of an autonomous status under Moroccan sovereignty.
byline: By Alexandre Aublanc (Casablanca (Morocco), correspondent) and Simon Roger

title: Louvre heist: Two suspects to be charged, jewelry not recovered
subhead: 'At this stage, there is no evidence to suggest that the thieves had any accomplices within the museum,' said the Paris prosecutor during a press conference a week after the spectacular theft.

title: Madagascar's new government faces scrutiny from Gen Z
subhead: President Michaël Randrianirina announced the 28 members of the government on Tuesday, October 28. Opposition leaders to the ousted regime, newcomers and technocrats now have 60 days to deliver results.

title: Jacques-Louis David, at home in the Louvre
subhead: The exhibition at the Paris museum brings together around a hundred works, paintings and drawings, including some on loan from Brussels, where the artist sought refuge after the Bourbon Restoration.

Three exhibitions in Paris celebrate 100 years of Art Deco
subhead: To mark the centenary of the International Exhibition of Modern Decorative and Industrial Arts, three venues are showcasing a leading figure of the movement, the archives of a renowned trunk-maker and contemporary creations.

title: 'You can see poverty spreading': France's welfare services confront growing hardship
subhead: Around France, agents of the CAF, a government body that provides welfare benefits, deal with difficult situations as social precarity increases.

title: Too old to get a job, too young to retire: The French women over 50 stuck in limbo
subhead: In France, 21% of people aged 55-61 struggle to find work but are unable to retire. Women, who suffer more from societal inequalities throughout their career, are particularly at risk.
